Name: rutile production, synthetic, 95% titanium dioxide, Benelite process | rutile, 95% titanium dioxide | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Description: The production of synthetic rutile from ilmenite by its leaching with hydrochloric acid. The amounts of materials both on the input and on the output are calculated using stoichiometric equation relations. In order to produce 1 kg of  rutile (95% TiO2, i.e. 0.95 kg of TiO2), 1.687 kg of titanium oxochloride (TiOCl2) is needed and 0.867 kg of hydrochloric acid is produced as by-product. 95% of this hydrochloric acid is recycled and returned back to the process. In order to produce 1.687 kg of oxochloride (TiOCl2), 1.922 kg of hydrochloride acid (HCl) and 2 kg of ilmenite (FeTiO3) is needed. When the recycled amount of hydrochloric acid is deducted the make-up amount is then (1.922-0.867*0.95=) 1.098kg.
